intro: Diarrhena diandra, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright blue or violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Diarrhena diandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
